entries.title: 'Like a mob movie': Tapper reacts to Hutchinson's Jan. 6 testimony transcript
entries.description: CNN's Jake Tapper breaks down insights revealed from transcripts of former Trump aide Cassidy Hutchinson's testimony before the January 6 committee.

entries.title: A bizarre trend: Was 2022 the year of the cannibal?
entries.description: Whatever you craved from the content gods in 2022, one thing that probably wasn't on your preferred menu: Multiple stories that focused on, explored, and even celebrated cannibalism. Yes, movies and TV shows about people eating people.

entries.title: These are Barack Obama's favorite movies and books of 2022
entries.description: Former President Barack Obama stuck to an annual tradition Friday, releasing a list of his favorites for the year of 2022, including movies and books.

entries.title: 'Can I go back to my regular job?': Iowa sports reporter goes viral after complaining about covering blizzard
entries.description: An Iowa sports reporter has gone viral for his vocal complaints after being asked to fill in for a weather reporter -- during a snowstorm.

entries.title: Only bad news in your feeds? Use our Good News Generator
Adnan Syed, exonerated after 23 years behind bars, hired by Georgetown to work on its Prisons and Justice Initiative
entries.description: Adnan Syed, recently exonerated after spending over two decades behind bars, is now working as a program associate for Georgetown University's Prisons and Justice Initiative, the school announced.

entries.title: CNN reporter barely visible just 40 yards from the camera amid storm
entries.description: CNN's Polo Sandoval is barely visible standing about 40 yards from the news camera amid severe winter weather in Buffalo, New York.

entries.title: House passes $1.7 trillion government spending bill as funding deadline looms
entries.description: The House voted Friday to pass a massive $1.7 trillion spending bill that would fund critical government operations across federal agencies and provide emergency aid for Ukraine and natural disaster relief. The bill will next go to President Joe Biden to be signed into law.

entries.title: Winter storm and severe cold sweeps across US
The secrets behind your favorite Christmas movie classics
entries.description: Watching Christmas movies is a whole tradition unto itself. Every family has their mainstays, whether it's an animated classic from yesteryear or a more modern take on holiday cheer.

entries.title: Inventor of the UK's 'true national dish' dies at 77
entries.description: With its chunks of spiced chicken surrounded by a rich tomato and yogurt-based sauce, chicken tikka masala is one of the UK's most beloved dishes.

entries.title: 10 moments in 2022 straight out of a sci-fi movie
entries.description: From a spacecraft the size of a refrigerator plowing into an asteroid (deliberately) to a helicopter trying to catch a rocket plummeting back to Earth, 2022 offered surreal moments in space that could have been ripped from the pages of a science fiction movie script.

entries.title: For first known time in public, Putin calls fighting in Ukraine a 'war'
What the Whitney Houston biopic reveals
entries.description: "My whole life: 'She ain't Black enough. She ain't White enough.' Well, how about she's not obedient enough? How 'bout she ain't fearful enough?"

entries.title: George Cohen, member of England's 1966 World Cup winning team, dies aged 83
entries.description: George Cohen, England's right-back for their 1966 World Cup triumph, has died aged 83. The news was announced by his former club Fulham on Friday. No cause of death was given.

entries.title: Can 'cycle syncing' workouts to your menstrual cycle improve fitness levels?
entries.description: If you're someone who has to deal with a period regularly, you're probably all too familiar with just how much your energy levels can change throughout your cycle thanks to hormonal fluctuations. Not only can this sometimes make even the simplest daily tasks challenging, it can make it even harder to stay motivated to keep fit and stick to your regular workout routine, especially when noticing a decline in your performance.

entries.title: 'Babylon' zooms in on Hollywood's wild old days, like 'Singin' in the Rain' on steroids
entries.description: After romanticizing Hollywood in "La La Land," Damien Chazelle widens his "Another Day of Sun" lens to explore the town's dark roots in "Babylon," which is basically another dawn-of-talkies era "Singin' in the Rain" on a cocktail of ampethamines and steroids. Despite a stellar cast and showy moments (given who's involved how could there not be?), the writer-director's sprawling, messy, three-hour-plus endurance test isn't ready for its closeup.

entries.title: Three dead, several injured in central Paris after gunman opens fire
entries.description: Three people died and four others were injured after a gunman opened fire in the 10th arrondissement of central Paris on Friday, local mayor Alexandra Cordebard said.

entries.title: Video shows scene in Paris after shooting
entries.description: Three people are dead and four others injured after a gunman opened fire in central Paris, local mayor Alexandra Cordebard said. CNN's Nada Bashir reports.

entries.title: The tech we couldn't live without in 2022
entries.description: Bone conduction headphones, TV streaming devices and Bluetooth speakers are among the tech gadgets topping holiday wish lists this year. Other notable products -- ahem, the new 14 Pro and 14 Pro Max -- are near impossible to find.

entries.title: This is the transportation secretary's top concern about winter storm
entries.description: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg joins "CNN This Morning" to discuss the winter storm sweeping across the US.

entries.title: FIFA investigating how celebrity chef got onto World Cup final pitch
entries.description: FIFA has launched an investigation into how individuals gained "undue access" to the pitch following the World Cup final after images and videos of Turkish celebrity chef Nusret Gokce celebrating with Argentina's players went viral on social media.

entries.title: UK wages next year will be at their lowest level since 2006, report says
entries.description: Brits hoping for a new-year salary bump to offset soaring food and energy costs may be disappointed.

entries.title: Italian rugby team Benetton Treviso suspends player amidst racism accusations, with Italian federal prosecutors to investigate
entries.description: Italian rugby team Benetton Treviso announced Thursday that they have suspended a member of their team after Guinea-born Italian international Cherif Traore received a "rotten banana in a wet bag" as a gift during a Christmas dinner.

entries.title: The royal family tree
The best food marketing stunts of the year
entries.description: Comically oversized snack foods. A cocktail infused with processed cheese. And a fine dining establishment for feline lovers.

entries.title: New York Jets quarterback Zach Wilson booed off during defeat by Jacksonville Jaguars
entries.description: Quarterback Zach Wilson endured a torrid night before eventually being benched as the New York ​​Jets were beaten 19-3 by the Jacksonville Jaguars on Thursday.

entries.title: A Covid-19 'senior wave' is driving up hospitalizations
entries.description: When Linda Stewart felt a tickle in her throat a few weeks ago, she got worried.

entries.title: Pigs are the latest casualty of Germany's energy crisis
entries.description: Pig herds in Germany have shrunk to a record low as producers battle soaring input costs, adding to the list of German industries hobbled by the energy crisis.

entries.title: 10 celebrity outfits that won the red carpet in 2022
entries.description: The 2022 red carpet circuit — filled with experimentation, self-expression and play — was one to remember.

entries.title: Stunning space photos of 2022 revealed the universe as it had never been seen before
French serial killer Charles 'The Serpent' Sobhraj released from Nepali jail
entries.description: Charles Sobhraj, the infamous French serial killer who inspired the award-nominated TV series "The Serpent," walked free from a Nepali prison Friday.

entries.title: In interview hours before his death, Franco Harris says 'Immaculate Reception' play 'blows my mind'
entries.description: Fifty years after the "Immaculate Reception" and just hours before his death, Franco Harris said it "blows my mind" how he pulled off arguably the most memorable play in NFL history.

entries.title: North Korea denies report claiming it sent arms to Russia
The royal family tree
How an underwater film inspired a marine protected area off Kenya's coast
entries.description: Famous for its sprawling nature reserves that are home to all "Big Five" animals, Kenya's 882 miles of coastline along the Indian Ocean are often overlooked. It's a place where people go to "chill out," but not to observe and connect with the wild and unique ecosystem, says Kenyan filmmaker, photographer and conservationist Jahawi Bertolli.

entries.title: The year in sport: A fond farewell for some, a glimpse of the future for others
entries.description: An athlete, former jockey AP McCoy said earlier this year, is the only person who dies twice, such is the pain of walking away from the intoxicating, all-consuming nature of professional sport.

entries.title: 'Shocked': Russia expert explains why Putin's change of word is significant
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin used the word "war" to refer to the conflict in Ukraine, the first known time he has publicly deviated from his carefully crafted description of Moscow's invasion as a "special military operation" 10 months after it began. CNN contributor Jill Dougherty explains the significance.

entries.title: Vandals destroy 22,000-year-old sacred cave art in Australia, horrifying indigenous community
entries.description: In a flat, arid stretch of southern Australia, the Koonalda Cave is home to art that dates back 22,000 years -- a sacred site for the indigenous Mirning People and a discovery that transformed scientists' understanding of history.

entries.title: The couple who met on a plane on Christmas Day
entries.description: For Catalina Bernal Andrade, Christmas 2009 was unusual -- in more ways than one.

entries.title: Migrants in El Paso have trouble finding shelter as dangerously cold temperatures arrive
entries.description: As freezing temperatures from a coast-to-coast winter storm arrive in El Paso, Texas, some migrants who haven't turned themselves in to border agents or officials after crossing the US-Mexico border are having a difficult time finding shelter.

entries.title: Save Rohingya from starvation at sea, UN refugee agency urges Asian countries
entries.description: The plight of nearly 200 Rohingya refugees adrift in the Indian Ocean for the past month is growing increasingly desperate, the United Nations' refugee agency said Friday, as it repeated its call for countries in the region to help save them.

entries.title: North Korea fires at least one ballistic missile, South Korea says
entries.description: North Korea launched at least one ballistic missile on Friday, according to South Korean officials, the latest in an unprecedented year of weapons testing.

entries.title: QAnon members in Japan sentenced for breaking into Covid vaccination centers
entries.description: Several members of a QAnon group in Japan were sentenced by a Tokyo court on Thursday for breaking into multiple Covid vaccination centers, according to CNN affiliate TV Asahi.

entries.title: Record-low temps and power outages arrive before Christmas in major US storm
entries.description: The massive winter storm battering the US with plunging temperatures coast-to-coast has left thousands without power and prompted more than a dozen governors to create emergency response plans ahead of Christmas weekend.

entries.title: Friday flight cancellations top 2,500, disrupting holiday travel
entries.description: Winter weather continues to disrupt holiday travel across the United States on Friday, leaving travelers facing delays and cancellations during one of the busiest times of the year.

entries.title: North Korea denies report claiming it sent arms to Russia
Iranian footballer is among dozens facing execution while West is distracted by Christmas, supporters fear
entries.description: Shahid Alikhani square is a nondescript part of the historic Iranian city of Isfahan. Its sole claim to prominence is the grand entrance to one of the city's main metro stations.

entries.title: Democracy has its flaws but has emerged from pandemic in better health than alternative
See what Liz Cheney wrote about Republicans in the Jan. 6 report
entries.description: In the final report from the January 6 committee, Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) says she "had hoped for more" from members of her party who supported former President Donald Trump in wake of the insurrection at the US Capitol.

entries.title: Here's what school protocols Bill Gates thinks didn't work during pandemic
entries.description: Bill Gates opens up with CNN's Anderson Cooper about pandemic protocols for schools and why he thinks it should have played out differently.

entries.title: For first known time in public, Putin calls fighting in Ukraine a 'war'
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday used the word "war" to refer to the conflict in Ukraine, the first known time he has publicly deviated from his carefully crafted description of Moscow's invasion as a "special military operation" 10 months after it began.

entries.title: The unique way Lizzo avoids copyright lawsuits
entries.description: Lizzo credited the tweet that inspired the lyrics of "Truth Hurts." The FlashDoc "Taking On Taylor Swift" examines creators' rights and originality in an industry rocked by multiple lawsuits. It premieres Friday, December 23, at 9 p.m. ET.

entries.title: Read the Jan. 6 committee's full 845-page report here
Jan. 6 committee releases full final report
entries.description: • Read the full report here

entries.title: Sportscaster can't stop complaining as he fills in as weatherman in hilarious live hits
entries.description: Instead of his usual broadcast, sports reporter Mark Woodley was asked to cover the incoming winter storm in Waterloo, IA for the morning show.

entries.title: Body bags filling up crates in China as Covid rages on
entries.description: Morgues and crematoriums in China are overflowed as Covid rages through the country despite no reporting on new Covid deaths. CNN's Selina Wang is in Beijing with the story.

entries.title: Wagner mercenary group denies US claim that it took weapons from North Korea
entries.description: • Russian citizens are now crowdfunding equipment for troops

entries.title: Wagner mercenary group denies US claim that it took weapons from North Korea
entries.description: • Russian citizens are now crowdfunding equipment for troops

entries.title: 'He knows he lost': Cassidy Hutchinson testified that Trump acknowledged he lost 2020 election
entries.description: Shortly after the 2020 election was called for Joe Biden, then-White House chief of staff Mark Meadows told his aide, Cassidy Hutchinson, that President Donald Trump knew he lost but wanted to keep fighting to overturn the results, according to a newly released transcript from the House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection.

entries.title: Twitter layoffs continue under Elon Musk
entries.description: Additional Twitter employees were terminated Thursday as part of ongoing, rolling layoffs under new owner Elon Musk, including from the public policy and media and entertainment teams, according to tweets from affected employees.

entries.title: As a surge of infections slams China and crematoriums fill up, officials insist that by the government's own count, few people are dying of Covid
